reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Park Hyatt for 3 nights after 3 nights at Courtyard Marriott at Times Square.
reviews.title: modern & elegant

reviews.text: Upon arrival, the ground floor staffs are very helpful and directed us to the reception at 24th floor. Check in was smooth and everyone is very professional. The atmosphere is modern and elegant thru out the building. Decorated with very nice modern korean art pieces along the hall way and our room.
reviews.title: Beautifully designed hotel with excellent service, large rooms, and fantastic views

reviews.text: We are delighted with our Park King room on the 8th floor, well maintained room which is larger than our room at Courtyard Marriott. Nice little touches such as infusion tea bags, filtered coffee maker, fresh fruits, etc. The bath tub and shower is really nice. But I suppose 'you get what you pay'...
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: Our room is a bit noisy.... as it's only located on 8th floor, i should have asked for a higher floor!
reviews.title: *Beautiful*

reviews.text: Nice small swimming pool on the 24th floor with nice city view, and we really enjoyed the spa and sauna.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Seoul!!

reviews.text: First, I must say that the Park Hyatt is quite a good property with spectacular desk service and no glaring deficiencies, yet I found it a bit short on several counts relative to other properties that have earned such high marks on the Conde Nast Gold List, which joins TripAdvisor as a highly trusted source in choosing hotel stays.
reviews.title: A Tad Short of Expectations Given A Lofty 95.2 Conde Nast Score

reviews.text: Likes:
reviews.title: Luxury!

reviews.text: Warm and intuitive desk service
reviews.title: Subtle touches

reviews.text: Airy rooms that maximize natural light
reviews.title: A favourite hotel WW

reviews.text: Generous amenities and daily fruit service
reviews.title: Could very well be the best hotel in the world

reviews.text: I recently stayed here on a business trip and this is one of the most interesting hotels that i have been in. It is quite unconventional and in many ways is more like a boutique hotel. It is located in a highrise right across from COEX in the main business Gangnam area. The check in is actually on the top floor and you have to navigate a rather complex set of elevators to go to the "lobby", your room, and the ground floor.
reviews.title: a lovely hotel with some interesting quirks

reviews.text: The rooms are stunning with floor to ceiling windows and handsome wood floors. The rooms have a very zen feel to them ranging from the minimalist furniture to the faux-rock showers. Amenities are top notch (Aesop) and everything is automated.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: I unfortunately developed a very bad cold while in Seoul and ended up having to see a doctor. The hotel made the arrangements for a house visit and when he arrived the concierge accompanied him and stayed throughout the visit to ensure I was ok. I wish I had felt better so I could have visited the bars and restaurants which are supposed to be excellent. I did take a look at the gym which looked very modern albeit a bit small and the stunning pool which, while too small to do serious lapwork, had incredible city views. hopefully next time I return I will be feeling better and able to take advantage of all this hotel has to offer.
reviews.title: Still a very nice hotel - bus from airport to hotel is huge bargain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed overnight at the Hyatt with my husband and son, on our return flight from Auckland to the UK. It was part of the deal with Korean Airlines. I had checked Tripadvisor prior to going so was pretty confident that the hotel would be ok. It was exceptional. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The facilities were brilliant, the breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Overall a lovely experience and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: How does the Park Hyatt compare to the Coex Intercontinental

reviews.text: I last stayed at the Park Hyatt Seoul in 2008 and you can read my previous review labeled “Modern Room Surrounded by Good Old Fashion Service”.
reviews.title: The most amazing Hotel I've ever stayed at.

reviews.text: Room furnishings are excellent. I especially liked the toilettries.Floor to ceiling windows are dramatic and allow for great light.
reviews.title: Sleek post modern design.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in and check out process was so smooth I don't even remember it.
reviews.title: simply the best

reviews.text: we stayed for 5 days in this hotel during our Christmas & new year holiday.
reviews.title: The place to stay!

reviews.text: the room was fantastic, not like any other hotels we've stayed before. Very spacious and very good interior design on the room and the bathroom. The cleaners did a very good job cleaning the room, spotless.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, good location, so-so service

reviews.text: Staff were very helpful. They all speak English and greeted us with sincere gesture.
reviews.title: Room not ready for check-in
